benchmark_details.name: ALAS (Automatic Latent Alignment Score)
benchmark_details.overview: ALAS is a metric for assessing alignment quality in speech-text multimodal Large Language Models (LLMs), designed to measure correlations between audio and text representations across transformer layers.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To measure the semantic alignment between audio and text modalities in spoken language understanding with multimodal LLMs.

methods: Comparison against reference alignment from Whisper
methodology.calculation: ALAS score is calculated using cross-modal similarities and the monotonic-alignment-search algorithm.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ALAS scores indicate better alignment between audio and text representations.
methodology.validation: Validated through quantitative comparisons with existing multimodal LLMs' performances on tasks.
